  • Method Details

    • getJdbcDrivers

      public static Collection<JdbcDriverInfo> getJdbcDrivers()
      Get Map with known JDBC drivers.
      Returns:
      collection of DriverInfo instances for the known JDBC drivers

    • toLocalDate

      public static @Nullable LocalDate toLocalDate(@Nullable Object item)
      Get LocalDate from SQL result. ResultSet.getObject(String) might return either Date or LocalDate. This method returns an instance of LocalDate in both cases.
      Parameters:
      item - an Object representing a date in an SQL ResultSet
      Returns:
      LocalDate instance or null
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if item is neither null nor of the supported types

    • toLocalDateTime

      public static @Nullable LocalDateTime toLocalDateTime(@Nullable Object item)
      Get LocalDateTime from SQL result. ResultSet.getObject(String) might return either Timestamp or LocalDateTime. This method returns an instance of LocalDateTime in both cases.
      Parameters:
      item - an Object representing a timestamp in an SQL ResultSet
      Returns:
      LocalDateTime instance or null
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if item is neither null nor of the supported types

    • toLocalTime

      public static @Nullable LocalTime toLocalTime(@Nullable Object item)
      Get LocalTime from SQL result. ResultSet.getObject(String) might return either Time or LocalTime. This method returns an instance of LocalTime in both cases.
      Parameters:
      item - an Object representing a time value in an SQL ResultSet
      Returns:
      LocalTime instance or null
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if item is neither null nor of the supported types

    • loadDriver

      public static Optional<Driver> loadDriver(URL... urls) throws ClassNotFoundException, SQLException
      Load JDBC driver.
      Parameters:
      urls - the URLs used to construct a ClassLoader instance
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the driver object or an empty Optional if not driver class is found
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - if a driver class could be determined but could not be loaded
      SQLException - if a driver class was found and loaded but could not be instantiated

    • loadDriver

      public static Optional<Driver> loadDriver(ClassLoader loader) throws ClassNotFoundException, SQLException
      Load JDBC driver.

      Note: the Driver returned can in general not be used with `DriverManager.getConnection()` because the `DriverManager` class checks that the class can be loaded from the parent class loader which is not the case. It can however be used directly or as driver for a `JdbcDataSource`.

      Parameters:
      loader - the ClassLoader instance
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the driver object or an empty Optional if not driver class is found on the classpath
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - if a driver class could be determined but could not be loaded
      SQLException - if a driver class was found and loaded but could not be instantiated

    • createDataSource

      public static DataSource createDataSource(Driver driver, String url, String user, String password) throws SQLException
      Create DataSource.
      Parameters:
      driver - the driver to use
      url - the database URL
      user - the database user
      password - the database password
      Returns:
      DataSource instance
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the driver does not accept the URL or connecting fails

    • stream

      public static <T> Stream<T> stream(ResultSet rs, Function<? super ResultSet,? extends T> mapper, AutoCloseable... closeables) throws SQLException
      Create a stream of objects from a ResultSet.

      IMPORTANT: do not close the database or the result set before all stream items are consumed. The result set will be automatically closed together with the stream. If more resources have to be closed, pass them in the closables parameter; the items given in closeables will be closed in reversed order (right to left) before closing the result set.

      Type Parameters:
      T - stream item type
      Parameters:
      rs - the ResultSet
      mapper - mapping function to convert the current result item to the object type
      closeables - additional AutoCloseable instances to close when the stream is closed
      Returns:
      stream of objects created from the result set items
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an SQL exception occurrs
